text:
Anxiety filled the room. 

Razumihin rushed in. 

“It's nothing! Just a faint!” he reassured. 

He lifted the sick man to the sofa. 

The mother and sister cried out in horror. 

Raskolnikov waved his hand weakly. 

“Enough,” he seemed to say. 

He held their hands, gazing deeply. 

His expression was both pained and unyielding. 

Silence hung heavy between them.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin reassures Raskolnikov's family after he faints, insisting it is just a minor issue despite their anxiety.
